remarks: Lemma for ~ lcfl6 .  A functional ` G ` (whose kernel is closed by ~ dochsnkr ) is comletely determined by a vector ` X ` in the orthocomplement in its kernel at which the functional value is 1.  Note that the ` \ { .0. } ` in the ` X ` hypothesis is redundant by the last hypothesis but allows easier use of other theorems.  (Contributed by NM, 3-Jan-2015.)
statement:
lcfl6lem.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
lcfl6lem.o $e |- ._|_ = ( ( ocH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lcfl6lem.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lcfl6lem.v $e |- V = ( Base ` U ) $.
lcfl6lem.a $e |- .+ = ( +g ` U ) $.
lcfl6lem.t $e |- .x. = ( .s ` U ) $.
lcfl6lem.s $e |- S = ( Scalar ` U ) $.
lcfl6lem.i $e |- .1. = ( 1r ` S ) $.
lcfl6lem.r $e |- R = ( Base ` S ) $.
lcfl6lem.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` U ) $.
lcfl6lem.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` U ) $.
lcfl6lem.l $e |- L = ( LKer ` U ) $.
lcfl6lem.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
lcfl6lem.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. F ) $.
lcfl6lem.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. ( ( ._|_ ` ( L ` G ) ) \ { .0. } ) ) $.
lcfl6lem.y $e |- ( ph -> ( G ` X ) = .1. ) $.
lcfl6lem $p |- ( ph -> G = ( v e. V |-> ( iota_ k e. R E. w e. ( ._|_ ` { X } ) v = ( w .+ ( k .x. X ) ) ) ) ) $.
$d .+ k v w $.
$d .0. w $.
$d .1. k w $.
$d ._|_ k v w $.
$d .x. k v w $.
$d R k v $.
$d S k $.
$d V v $.
$d X k v w $.
